SectionBody.Text: To promote honest and fair dealing in the interest of the consumer, the department may determine, establish, and promulgate, from time to time, reasonable grades and standards of quality for eggs to be sold or offered for sale in the state; and the department may alter or modify such grades and standards of quality from time to time, as honest and fair dealing in the interest of the consumer may require; however, the grades, grade tolerances, and standards of quality so fixed by the department shall not exceed those stipulated in 7 C.F.R. part 56.
